syllabus:
**_Freshman English_ (Fall 2012)**

**Instructor**: Miao-Hsia Chang ([mhchang@ntnu.edu.tw](`mailto:mhchang@ntnu.edu.tw`))

**Office:** Cheng 817

**Office hours**: Tue 10-12AM; Thur 12-2pm

**Course Objective:**

This is an advanced English training course of four skills--listening, speaking, reading and writing--with the listening and speaking skills especially emphasized. Materials on a variety of topics such as education, culture, technology, business and medicine are offered. Films of cultural interest and other relevant materials are also brought into the lab. Classroom activities combine the skills of listening with speaking. Students are required to prepare lessons in advance and to discuss related issues in class. Instructor will use English when giving class lectures or conducting discussions so that students have more opportunities to hear and use English.

**Grading Policy:**

1.      **Attendance, Participation and Quizzes (15%):**

l   Students are expected to attend the class on time well-prepared. Tardiness and/or absences will probably affect your learning and will lead to a poorer final grade. Business leave should be reported to the instructor prior to the date of your leave with a personal email to the instructor explaining the reason for the leave. A sick leave is only accepted after you submit a receipt from the hospital/clinic or the health center indicating the time of your doctor visit. Except for emergency, quizzes and examinations cannot be made up. **If you miss a class, it is your responsibility to find out if there is a quiz in the following week and what material was covered during your absence.** If you are **absent on THREE** occasions (with or without official documentation as proof of your absence), you will **FAIL** the course. Email leave-of-absence submitted via the school administrative system will **NOT** be accepted.

l   Active participation in class activities and discussions is strongly encouraged. Those who fail to participate when necessary will lead to poor evaluation by the instructor.

l   There may be a brief quiz after each coursebook topic.

2.      **Lab work: 10%** (including visits to the Writing Clinic)

l   You are **required** to practice your listening and speaking skills by visiting the lab at 樸102 after class. This includes:

a.       **Eight lab visits** using any resources in the center. Record of your visit will be emailed to the instructor.

b.    **Writing Clinic consultation(s)**

3.      **Writing assignments**: 5%

4.      **Individual and Group Presentation**: 20%

5.      **Midterm**: 25%

6.      **Final exam:** 25%

7.      **Extra credit:** Extra credit will be given to a) those who visit the lab more than the minimum requirement; (1 point added to the final grade for 3 more visits), and/or b) those who participate (and win a prize) in any type of English competitions hosted by the English Department. (2 points for those who participate; 3 points for any runner-ups; 4 points for champion)
